page.title: 11Entertainment in NW Derby
page.content: Entertainment in our area was given a tremendous fillip in November 1977, when the{Assembly Rooms}were opened. Overlooking the Market Place they consist of the Great Hall where 1850 people can listen to live concerts or watch snooker, darts, wrestling, etc.; the Darwin Suite (300 people) for dancing, discos and aerobics; and the Reception Suite (50 people) for VIP's. {Derby Playhouse}in the Eagle Centre is used mostly for theatre, occasionally for films and every year a pantomime is shown. Other entertainment includes 2 cinemas, the Guildhall, Carlton Casino, Mecca Bingo Hall, several night clubs & working mens' clubs and the Greyhound Stadium. There are also several Youth Centres where young people can play pool, snooker, table tennis, etc.
